meta.dc:subject: legislation
meta.dc:rights: the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

main.enactingFormula: ( Cap. 622, sections 26 and 909 and Cap. 1, section 29)

section.name: s2
section.heading: Fees payable in relation to registration of companies or for registration of documents

subsection.content: A fee specified in column 3 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 is payable to the Registrar in respect of the matter described, opposite the fee, in column 2 of that Part in relation to the registration of a company having a share capital or for the registration of a document delivered to the Registrar in respect of such a company.
Subsection (1) does not apply to a company formed as, or became, a company limited by guarantee having a share capital before 13 February 2004.

A fee specified in column 3 of Part 2 of Schedule 1 is payable to the Registrar in respect of the matter described, opposite the fee, in column 2 of that Part in relation to the registration of a company limited by guarantee or for the registration of a document delivered to the Registrar in respect of such a company.

A fee specified in column 3 of Part 3 of Schedule 1 is payable to the Registrar in respect of the matter described, opposite the fee, in column 2 of that Part in relation to the registration of a registered non-Hong Kong company or for the registration of a document delivered to the Registrar in respect of such a company.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Fees for inspecting or obtaining documents or information

subsection.content: A fee specified in column 3 of Part 2 of Schedule 2 is payable to the Registrar in respect of the matter described, opposite the fee, in column 2 of that Part.
A fee specified in column 4 of Part 2 of Schedule 2 is payable to the Registrar in respect of the matter described, opposite the fee, in column 2 of that Part.
A fee specified in column 5 of Part 2 of Schedule 2 is payable to the Registrar in respect of the matter described, opposite the fee, in column 2 of that Part.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Fees for Registrar’s approval or licence
section.content: A fee specified in column 3 of Schedule 3 is payable to the Registrar in respect of the matter described, opposite the fee, in column 2 of that Schedule.

subsection.content: A fee specified in column 3 of Part 1 of Schedule 4 is payable to the Registrar in respect of the matter described, opposite the fee, in column 2 of that Part.
A fee specified in column 3 of Part 2 of Schedule 4 is payable to the Financial Secretary in respect of the matter described, opposite the fee, in column 2 of that Part.

schedule.name: sch1
schedule.heading: Fees Payable in relation to Registration of Companies or for Registration of Documents

part.name: P1
part.heading: Fees Payable in relation to Company Having Share Capital

td.p: For registration of a company under Division 1 of Part 3 of the Ordinance—
if the documents required for the purpose, as referred to in section 67(1)(b) of the Ordinance, are delivered in electronic form
if those documents are delivered in hard copy form
For lodging of an incorporation form and a copy of the articles referred to in section 67(1)(b) of the Ordinance—
if those documents are delivered in electronic form
if those documents are delivered in hard copy form
For re-registration of a company under section 130 of the Ordinance—
if the documents required for the purpose, as referred to in section 131(1) of the Ordinance, are delivered in electronic form
if those documents are delivered in hard copy form
For lodging of an application and a copy of the articles referred to in section 131(1) of the Ordinance—
if those documents are delivered in electronic form
if those documents are delivered in hard copy form
For registration of an eligible company under section 807(1)(a) of the Ordinance—
if the documents required for the purpose, as referred to in section 807(2) and (3)(a) of the Ordinance, are delivered in electronic form
if those documents are delivered in hard copy form
For lodging of an application and a copy of every constitutional document referred to in section 807(2) and (3)(a) of the Ordinance—
if those documents are delivered in electronic form
if those documents are delivered in hard copy form
For lodging of a re-domiciliation form delivered under section 820B(2)(a) of the Ordinance and the other documents delivered under section 820B(2)(b) and (3)(c) of the Ordinance—
if the re-domiciliation form and the other documents are delivered in electronic form
if the re-domiciliation form and the other documents are delivered in hard copy form (14 of 2025 s. 90)
For registration of a body corporate under section 820C(1) of the Ordinance—
if the documents required for the purpose, as referred to in section 820B(2) and (3)(c) of the Ordinance, are delivered in electronic form
if those documents are delivered in hard copy form (14 of 2025 s. 90)
Annual registration fee of an annual return of a private company delivered under section 662(1) of the Ordinance—
if the annual return is delivered within 42 days after the company’s return date
if the annual return is delivered more than 42 days after but within 3 months after the company’s return date
if the annual return is delivered more than 3 months after but within 6 months after the company’s return date
if the annual return is delivered more than 6 months after but within 9 months after the company’s return date
if the annual return is delivered more than 9 months after the company’s return date
Annual registration fee of an annual return of a public company delivered under section 662(3) of the Ordinance—
if the annual return is delivered within 42 days after the company’s return date
if the annual return is delivered more than 42 days after but within 3 months after the company’s return date
if the annual return is delivered more than 3 months after but within 6 months after the company’s return date
if the annual return is delivered more than 6 months after but within 9 months after the company’s return date
if the annual return is delivered more than 9 months after the company’s return date

part.name: P2
part.heading: Fees Payable in relation to Company Limited by Guarantee

td.p: For registration under Division 1 of Part 3 of the Ordinance of a company whose number of members, as stated in the incorporation form, does not exceed 25—
if the documents required for the purpose, as referred to in section 67(1)(b) of the Ordinance, are delivered in electronic form
if those documents are delivered in hard copy form
For registration under Division 1 of Part 3 of the Ordinance of a company whose number of members, as stated in the incorporation form, exceeds 25 but does not exceed 100—
if the documents required for the purpose, as referred to in section 67(1)(b) of the Ordinance, are delivered in electronic form
if those documents are delivered in hard copy form
For registration under Division 1 of Part 3 of the Ordinance of a company whose number of members, as stated in the incorporation form, exceeds 100—
if the documents required for the purpose, as referred to in section 67(1)(b) of the Ordinance, are delivered in electronic form
$305 plus $18 for every additional 50 members (or less) after the first 100 members, subject to a maximum sum of $925
if those documents are delivered in hard copy form
$340 plus $20 for every additional 50 members (or less) after the first 100 members, subject to a maximum sum of $1,025
For registration under section 114(1) of the Ordinance of any increase in the number of members of a company (beyond the registered number), in respect of every 50 members (or less) of that increase—
if the document required for the purpose, as referred to in that section, is delivered in electronic form

$18 (but the sum of the fee payable for that increase, the fee paid on the registration of the company, and the fee paid for any previous increase in the number of members of the company, must not exceed $925)
if that document is delivered in hard copy form

$20 (but the sum of the fee payable for that increase, the fee paid on the registration of the company, and the fee paid for any previous increase in the number of members of the company, must not exceed $1,025)
For registration under section 807(1)(b) of the Ordinance of an eligible company whose number of members, as stated in the application, does not exceed 25—
if the documents required for the purpose, as referred to in section 807(2) and (3) of the Ordinance, are delivered in electronic form
if those documents are delivered in hard copy form
For registration under section 807(1)(b) of the Ordinance of an eligible company whose number of members, as stated in the application, exceeds 25 but does not exceed 100—
if the documents required for the purpose, as referred to in section 807(2) and (3) of the Ordinance, are delivered in electronic form
if those documents are delivered in hard copy form
For registration under section 807(1)(b) of the Ordinance of an eligible company whose number of members, as stated in the application, exceeds 100—
if the documents required for the purpose, as referred to in section 807(2) and (3) of the Ordinance, are delivered in electronic form
$305 plus $18 for every additional 50 members (or less) after the first 100 members, subject to a maximum sum of $925
if those documents are delivered in hard copy form
$340 plus $20 for every additional 50 members (or less) after the first 100 members, subject to a maximum sum of $1,025
Annual registration fee for an annual return delivered under section 662(3) of the Ordinance—
if the annual return is delivered within 42 days after the company’s return date
if the annual return is delivered more than 42 days after but within 3 months after the company’s return date
if the annual return is delivered more than 3 months after but within 6 months after the company’s return date
if the annual return is delivered more than 6 months after but within 9 months after the company’s return date
if the annual return is delivered more than 9 months after the company’s return date

part.name: P3
part.heading: Fees Payable in relation to Registered Non-Hong Kong Company

td.p: For registration of a company under section 777(1) of the Ordinance—
if the documents required for the purpose, as referred to in section 776(4) of the Ordinance, are delivered in electronic form
if those documents are delivered in hard copy form
For lodging of an application and accompanying documents referred to in section 776(4) of the Ordinance—
if the application and documents are delivered in electronic form
if the application and documents are delivered in hard copy form
For issuing a fresh certificate of registration under section 779(1)(b), 782(5)(b), 783(3)(b) or 785(5)(c) of the Ordinance
Annual registration fee of a return delivered under section 788 of the Ordinance—
if the return is delivered within 42 days after the anniversary of registration
if the return is delivered more than 42 days after but within 3 months after the anniversary of registration
if the return is delivered more than 3 months after but within 6 months after the anniversary of registration
if the return is delivered more than 6 months after but within 9 months after the anniversary of registration
if the return is delivered more than 9 months after the anniversary of registration

schedule.name: sch2
schedule.heading: Fees for Inspecting or Obtaining Documents or Information

section.name: s1
section.def: document (文件) includes a document in electronic form or any other form;
principal account (主要帳户) means the first account that a registered online user registers with the Registrar under a registration arrangement;

def.name: RegisteredNonHongKongCompany
def.leadIn: registered non-Hong Kong company (註冊非香港公司) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a non-Hong Kong company registered under section 777(1) of the Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b

section.def: registered online user (登記用户) means a person who has entered into a registration arrangement with the Registrar;

registration arrangement (登記安排) means an arrangement under which a person may register one or more accounts with the Registrar through which that person may use online medium, at fees that are the same as or lesser than those payable by an unregistered online user, for inspecting and obtaining documents and information specified in items 1, 2, 3, 5 and 7 of Part 2 of this Schedule;
reporting documents (報告文件) has the meaning given by section 357(2) of the Ordinance;

unregistered online user (無帳户使用者) means a person, not in the capacity of a registered online user, using an online medium for inspecting or obtaining documents and information specified in items 1, 2, 3, 5 and 7 of Part 2 of this Schedule.

section.name: s2
section.leadIn: In items 3(o), 4(o) and 5(o) of Part 2 of this Schedule—
section.def: company (公司) includes an unregistered company as defined by section 326 of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32).

part.name: P2
part.heading: Fees for Inspecting or Obtaining Documents or Information

td.center:
Column 3
Fee payable
by
unregistered
online user

Column 4
Fee payable
by
registered
online user

Column 5
Fee payable
by on-site
user

tr.td: Under section 647(3) or 802(3) or both, of the Ordinance for inspecting the index of directors kept by the Registrar—
for each inspection of the list of directors and reserve directors (if any) of a company, or of the list of directors of a registered non-Hong Kong company
for each inspection of the particulars of a director or reserve director of a company, or of the particulars of a director of a registered non-Hong Kong company

for each inspection of all the directorships and reserve directorships held by a person in any companies, and all the directorships held by that person in any registered non-Hong Kong companies (whichever is applicable)

Under section 168R(4) of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32), for each inspection of the register of disqualification orders maintained by the Registrar, per disqualified person
Under section 45(4) of the Ordinance, for obtaining, by way of downloading through online medium, an image record of the following documents kept by the Registrar—
the prospectus of a company, or a company incorporated outside Hong Kong, registered under the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32)
the memorandum or memorandum and articles of a company registered under a former Companies Ordinance
the interim accounts under section 79H of the predecessor Ordinance or interim financial statements under section 305 of the Ordinance prepared for a proposed distribution by a listed company
the initial accounts under section 79I of the predecessor Ordinance or initial financial statements under section 306 of the Ordinance prepared for a proposed distribution by a listed company

the balance sheet (including any documents annexed to it), auditor’s report and directors’ report forwarded under section 109(3) of the predecessor Ordinance in relation to an annual return of a company other than a private company, or reporting documents accompanying an annual return delivered under section 662 of the Ordinance by a public company or a company limited by guarantee
each annual return of a company (but excluding those documents described in paragraph (g))
the instrument creating or evidencing a charge and related documents delivered under section 335, 336, 338, 338A, 339 or 340 of the Ordinance (14 of 2025 s. 91)
the instrument accompanying a notification delivered under section 345(3) of the Ordinance
the charter, statutes, memorandum (including articles, if any), or any other instrument constituting or defining the constitution of a registered non-Hong Kong company
the lists of the directors, the company secretary and the authorized representative in a specified form delivered under an application to register a non-Hong Kong company
each annual return of a registered non-Hong Kong company
the accounts of a registered non-Hong Kong company
the accounts made up by a liquidator in respect of a company being wound up under the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32)
Under section 45(4) of the Ordinance, for obtaining, at the office for the registration of companies, a copy of an image record of the following documents kept by the Registrar—
the prospectus of a company, or a company incorporated outside Hong Kong, registered under the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32)
the memorandum or memorandum and articles of a company registered under a former Companies Ordinance
the interim accounts under section 79H of the predecessor Ordinance or interim financial statements under section 305 of the Ordinance prepared for a proposed distribution by a listed company
the initial accounts under section 79I of the predecessor Ordinance or initial financial statements under section 306 of the Ordinance prepared for a proposed distribution by a listed company

the balance sheet (including any documents annexed to it), auditor’s report and directors’ report forwarded under section 109(3) of the predecessor Ordinance in relation to an annual return of a company other than a private company, or reporting documents accompanying an annual return delivered under section 662 of the Ordinance by a public company or a company limited by guarantee
each annual return of a company (but excluding those documents described in paragraph (g))
the instrument creating or evidencing a charge and related documents delivered under section 335, 336, 338, 338A, 339 or 340 of the Ordinance (14 of 2025 s. 91)
the instrument accompanying a notification delivered under section 345(3) of the Ordinance
the charter, statutes, memorandum (including articles, if any), or any other instrument constituting or defining the constitution of a registered non-Hong Kong company
the lists of the directors, the company secretary and the authorized representative in a specified form delivered under an application to register a non-Hong Kong company
each annual return of a registered non-Hong Kong company
the accounts of a registered non-Hong Kong company
the accounts made up by a liquidator in respect of a company being wound up under the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32)
Under section 45(3) and (4) of the Ordinance, for online inspection of, and obtaining, an image record of the following documents kept by the Registrar—
the prospectus of a company, or a company incorporated outside Hong Kong, registered under the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32)
the memorandum or memorandum and articles of a company registered under a former Companies Ordinance
the interim accounts under section 79H of the predecessor Ordinance or interim financial statements under section 305 of the Ordinance prepared for a proposed distribution by a listed company
the initial accounts under section 79I of the predecessor Ordinance or initial financial statements under section 306 of the Ordinance prepared for a proposed distribution by a listed company

the balance sheet (including any documents annexed to it), auditor’s report and directors’ report forwarded under section 109(3) of the predecessor Ordinance in relation to an annual return of a company other than a private company, or reporting documents accompanying an annual return delivered under section 662 of the Ordinance by a public company or a company limited by guarantee
each annual return of a company (but excluding those documents described in paragraph (g))
the instrument creating or evidencing a charge and related documents delivered under section 335, 336, 338, 338A, 339 or 340 of the Ordinance (14 of 2025 s. 91)
the instrument accompanying a notification delivered under section 345(3) of the Ordinance
the charter, statutes, memorandum (including articles, if any), or any other instrument constituting or defining the constitution of a registered non-Hong Kong company
the lists of the directors, the company secretary and the authorized representative in a specified form delivered under an application to register a non-Hong Kong company
each annual return of a registered non-Hong Kong company
the accounts of a registered non-Hong Kong company
the accounts made up by a liquidator in respect of a company being wound up under the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32)

If an image record of any document kept by the Registrar under the Ordinance is not available, for each inspection, under section 45(3) of the Ordinance, at the office for the registration of companies of the document or the relevant record kept by the Registrar
Under section 45(4) of the Ordinance, for obtaining a copy of any record containing the current particulars of a company or a registered non-Hong Kong company, per company
For registering an account with the Registrar for inspecting and obtaining documents and information specified in items 1, 2, 3, 5 and 7 per year (in addition to the fees payable under those items)—

schedule.name: sch3
schedule.heading: Fees Payable for Obtaining Registrar’s Approval or Licence

td.p:
Column 1
Item
For an approval under section 100(2) of the Ordinance
For a licence under section 103 of the Ordinance
For lodging of an application for a licence under section 103 of the Ordinance

Column 1
Item
For lodging of a notice of change of name delivered under section 107(2) or 770(2) of the Ordinance
For issuing a certificate of change of name under section 107(3) or 770(3) of the Ordinance
For registering—
under Part 8 of the Ordinance a charge created by, or a charge existing on property acquired by, a company or a registered non-Hong Kong company (14 of 2025 s. 92)
a notification under section 345(4) of the Ordinance
a notice of appointment of a receiver or manager, or of a mortgagee’s entering into possession, under section 348(3) or 349(3) of the Ordinance
For an application for deregistration of a company under section 750 of the Ordinance
For processing an application requesting the Registrar to represent a dissolved company or its liquidator under section 757 of the Ordinance
For the execution or signing of an instrument or a document by the Registrar under section 757 of the Ordinance
For issuing a copy of or an extract from the relevant document or record referred to in item 6 of Part 2 of Schedule 2, or an extract from any other document, per page
For certifying under section 45(4) of the Ordinance a copy of or an extract from a document, or a copy of information contained in a record, per copy or extract
For registration of a prospectus under section 38D or 342C of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32)

part.name: P2
part.heading: Miscellaneous Fees Payable to Financial Secretary

td.p:
Column 1
Item
For sending a copy of the inspector’s report under section 860(1)(b) of the Ordinance—
processing fee for provision of a copy of the report; and
fee for a copy of the report, per page
